body: On behalf of ViceWatercolour, I am going to say that he wishes to return to his Administrator position after his recent demotion from the rank. This is a decision that I will involve the whole community on, as its a rather important decision, and I believe its more than fair for the community to have a say in this.
body_tagged: On behalf of ViceWatercolour, I am going to say that he wishes to return to his Administrator position after his recent demotion from the rank. This is a decision that I will involve the whole community on, as its a rather important decision, and I believe its more than fair for the community to have a say in this.
title: Open Discussion: ViceWatercolours Return

replies.body: Para is an awesome guy, he did great as an admin and I would to see him keep on working with the admin team and improving the server, so yes from me.

replies.body:
He got demoted from Admin because he abused his powers.
If he returns, how will we know that he won't abuse them again?

He's returned from retirement once already so this second time he'd have to be a Junior as according to the retirement policy.
So I don't know why this is even being considered.

He also said "I don't want to be associated with the Senior Staff team" Right after he retired.

If he wants back in, he'll have to work up the ranks- as the policy states. 

I mean, if you need another admin, promote a Senior Moderator.

Posighdun's already had Administrator training.
He's the most ready/deserving at the moment.

replies.body:
With policies and the like, there's only so much you can think ahead. Policies help outline things for simpler cases, but there's so much that can happen you surely should not live or die by those pre-written standards, it'd be a dumb decision for any server or company or whatever. 
I think in that regard, with somebody who seems to contribute a large amount to the server, it's not worth getting particularly worked up over those. We want simply what's best for the server.
And if he has problems with the senior team, and they are considering bringing him back in and he is willing, then does it not seem that they have decided to work on those problems? Because it does to me. 

At least this is what I get out of this. I haven't been here awfully long and I haven't seen a lot of what happened previously, but a lot of people seem to agree with what Vice has said after his demotion and from that I'd think it would do well to have him working with the staff team again.
replies.body_tagged:
With policies and the like, there's only so much you can think ahead. Policies help outline things for simpler cases, but there's so much that can happen you surely should not live or die by those pre-written standards, it'd be a dumb decision for any server or company or whatever. 
I think in that regard, with somebody who seems to contribute a large amount to the server, it's not worth getting particularly worked up over those. We want simply what's best for the server.
And if he has problems with the senior team, and they are considering bringing him back in and he is willing, then does it not seem that they have decided to work on those problems? Because it does to me. 

At least this is what I get out of this. I haven't been here awfully long and I haven't seen a lot of what happened previously, but a lot of people seem to agree with what Vice has said after his demotion and from that I'd think it would do well to have him working with the staff team again.

No discussion is needed, No decision needs to be made.
The answer is no.

replies.body:
I have no problem with him returning - but honestly, we could return him as a Trial-Admin, or a Temporary-Mod, or a Temporary-Sr Mod. Overall it'd make sure he doesn't still have those commands. Personally I trust him 100%, but this would compensate for those players who are wary of him misusing his commands. He could not have access to them at the start, so that we would all have time to adjust before fully integrating him back to Administrator. 

Basically, it's a yes from me.
replies.body_tagged:
I have no problem with him returning - but honestly, we could return him as a Trial-Admin, or a Temporary-Mod, or a Temporary-Sr Mod. Overall it'd make sure he doesn't still have those commands. Personally I trust him 100%, but this would compensate for those players who are wary of him misusing his commands. He could not have access to them at the start, so that we would all have time to adjust before fully integrating him back to Administrator. 

Basically, it's a yes from me.

replies.body:
Good Admin

But he retired from SrMod. If you think about it, retiring and requesting a promotion straight to Admin is a quicker process than having to go from Sr back to Admin. If he does get promoted go to a rank lower than Sr.

Also Para abused perms so going straight back to a rank with lots of perms isnt a good idea imo

replies.body:
1. This new policy we are meant to be working so hard to enforce doesnt allow him to come back for a while.
2. Him jumping straight back up ahead of hard working mods would show a ton of bias.

That aside, I would still say no based on a single recent event:

Snow, one of the most dedicated and active mods got demoted for "Being a moderator"
Para got demoted for abusing his rank and now he's being asked back? Yeah no

If Snow gets given Sr I'd be cool with Para starting again at Jr Mod
